page.title: 13FARMING
page.content: All the woodlands in the area are owned by Lord Yarborough and combine with farming land to form Brocklesby Park Estate which totals 24000 acres of land. The estate woodlands total 3500 acres but this specially allocated "block" contains the area of woodland known as Mausoleum Woods which total 272 acres.A Head Forester is employed to be responsible for the management of all forestry operations. This includes day to day organisation, planting programmes, thinnings, felling and selling the timber. Planting. 7 acres was replanted during Autumn and early Spring.6000 trees Types. Oak Ash Sycamore,SweetChestnut, Wild Cherry,Lime,Red Cedar,Beech,Larch Corsican Pine. WEEDING.during Summer for first 4 years after planting.
